Daniel Pillis

I am a graduate student at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, part of the Tangible Media Group at the MIT Media Lab, where I work on human computer interaction. My advisor is Dr. Hiroshi Ishii.

From 2018 to 2020, I worked at Virginia Tech, as part of the Institute for Creativity, Arts & Technology. I primarily designed interactive large-scale immersive environments, using a variety of sensors including the Intel RealSense R200 and D400 motion capture systems. I also worked on pose estimation experiments, plant tracking systems, and human-computer interaction devices.

I have an MFA in Media Art from Carnegie Mellon University, where I was a research assistant for Dr. Chris Atkeson and a teaching assistant for Dr. Jessica Hodgins (15-465 & 15-894). I also have a BA in Psychology, English & Art from Rutgers University, where I worked in Gretchen Chapman's Decision Making lab.

Email  /  GitHub  /  LinkedIn

Research

I'm interested in simulations, digital twins, artificial intelligence, time, computer graphics, and robotics.
